name: Kachufool
shortDescription: A digital adaptation of the popular Indian trick-taking card game, playable with up to six opponents.
fullDescription:
Kachufool is a trick-taking card game where players predict the number of 'hands' or 'tricks' they can win in a round. The digital version features a competitive multiplayer table layout accommodating up to six players (or AI opponents) [screenshot1.jpg]. The game displays whose turn it is and the current round number [screenshot2.jpg]. Key gameplay elements include the 'Hakum' (Trump) suit, visible on the top right, and tracking of tricks won (0/0 score display for each player).

Key Features:
- Classic Indian trick-taking card game rules.
- Supports up to six players/opponents.
- Clearly indicates the 'Hakum' (Trump) suit for the round.
- Simple interface for tracking tricks won (hands).
